Example Sentence: El que lee mucho y viaja mucho, ve mucho y sabe mucho.
Translation: He who reads a lot and travels a lot, sees a lot and knows a lot.
Hint: Words often end in -o or -a and are phonetic (spelled like they sound)
Regions: Southern Europe, Central America, South America, Caribbean, Central Africa

Example Sentence: Ce qui peut être détruit par la vérité doit l’être.
Translation: That which can be destroyed by the truth should be.
Hint: The language of love and baguettes
Countries that this is a national langua: ['France', 'Canada', 'Belgium', 'Switzerland', 'Luxembourg', 'Monaco', 'Haiti', 'Democratic Republic of the Congo', 'Ivory Coast', 'Senegal', 'Madagascar', 'Cameroon', 'Niger', 'Mali', 'Rwanda', 'Mauritius', 'Benin', 'Burundi', 'Chad', 'Guinea', 'Republic of the Congo', 'Togo', 'Central African Republic', 'Djibouti', 'Equatorial Guinea', 'Gabon', 'Comoros', 'Vanuatu', 'Seychelles']
Regions: Western Europe, North America, Central Africa, West Africa, East Africa, Indian Ocean, Caribbean, Oceania

Example Sentence: 知道为什么而活的人几乎可以忍受任何生活。
Translation: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
Hint: Spoken by over a billion people

Example Sentence: अच्छी यात्रा करने के लिए अमीर होना ज़रूरी नहीं है।
Translation: You don’t have to be rich to travel well.
Hint: Bollywood speaks this language

Example Sentence: الكراهية سهلة، لكن الحب يتطلب الشجاعة.
Translation: Hate is easy, but love takes courage.
Hint: A language of the Quran and calligraphy
Regions: North Africa, Middle East, East Africa

Example Sentence: মানুষ স্বাধীনভাবে জন্মগ্রহণ করে, কিন্তু সর্বত্র সে শৃঙ্খলে আবদ্ধ।
Translation: Man was born free, but everywhere is in chains.
Hint: This language flows like the rivers of the Ganges delta

Example Sentence: E, quando você quer algo, todo o universo conspira para ajudar você a alcançá-lo.
Translation: And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.
Hint: Shares vocabulary roots with other Romance languages, but pronounces them very differently.
Regions: Southern Europe, South America, West Africa, Central Africa, Southeast Asia

Example Sentence: Именно возможность осуществления мечты делает жизнь интересной.
Translation: It's the possibility of having a dream come true that makes life interesting.
Hint: This language launched the first man into space

Example Sentence: ایک سے محبت کی جاتی ہے کیونکہ ایک سے پیار کیا جاتا ہے۔ محبت کے لیے کسی وجہ کی ضرورت نہیں ہوتی۔
Translation: One is loved because one is loved. No reason is needed for loving.
Hint: A poetic sibling of Hindi written in Arabic script

Example Sentence: Ingatlah bahwa di mana pun hatimu berada, di sanalah kau akan menemukan harta karunmu.
Translation: Remember that wherever your heart is, there you will find your treasure.
Hint: This is the official language of the world’s largest island country.

Example Sentence: In dem Moment, in dem wir beginnen, nach Liebe zu suchen, beginnt die Liebe, nach uns zu suchen.
Translation: The moment we begin to seek love, love begins to seek us.
Hint: The language of pretzels and philosophers.

Example Sentence: 決して忘れないでください。あらゆる障害の中には、私たちの状況を改善する機会が存在します。
Translation: Never forget, within every obstacle is an opportunity to improve our condition.
Hint: This island nation’s language uses three scripts.

Example Sentence: Viatjar és fatal per al prejudici, la intolerància i la mentalitat tancada.
Translation: Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness.
Hint: Has traits of both French and Spanish, but is its own thing entirely.

Example Sentence: Se pensi che l'avventura sia pericolosa, prova la routine. È letale.
Translation: If you think adventure is dangerous, try routine. It's lethal.
Hint: The language of pasta and opera.

Example Sentence: Trái đất có âm nhạc dành cho những ai lắng nghe.
Translation: The Earth has music for those who listen.
Hint: Spoken in the land of motorbikes and bánh mì.

Example Sentence: 여행은 모든 사람이 다른 나라에 대해 잘못 알고 있다는 것을 발견하는 것이다.
Translation: To travel is to discover that everyone is wrong about other countries.
Hint: Your favorite K-drama is in this langauge.

Example Sentence: Օրհնյալ են հետաքրքրասերները, քանզի արկածներ են ունենալու։
Translation: Blessed are the curious, for they shall have adventures.
Hint: This ancient language uses its own alphabet, has letters that look like magic symbols, and is spoken in a country where apricots are a national treasure.

Example Sentence: A kowane tafiya tare da yanayi mutum yana karɓar fiye da yadda yake nema.
Translation: In every walk with nature one receives far more than he seeks.
Hint: Has words that sound like they’re using glottal stops or “clicks,” but not exactly.

Example Sentence: Asili haina haraka, lakini kila kitu kinakamilika.
Translation: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
Hint: This smooth East African language blends African roots with Arabic flair. It's also the only one with a Lion King soundtrack

Example Sentence: จงมีความเมตตา เพราะทุกคนที่คุณพบกำลังต่อสู้กับความยากลำบาก
Translation: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.
Hint: This language loops, swirls, and curls, just like the noodles you’ll find on every corner of it's capital city

Example Sentence: Żeby być niezastąpionym, trzeba być zawsze innym.
Translation: In order to be irreplaceable one must always be different.
Hint: The “w” sounds like a “v,” and “ł” sounds like a “w.”

Example Sentence: دا مرګ نه دی چې سړی باید ترې ویره ولري، بلکې هیڅکله ژوند پیل نه کوي.
Translation: It is not death that a man should fear, but never beginning to live.
Hint: This warrior language flows through the hills of the Hindu Kush.

Example Sentence: Ağaçlar arasında geçirilen zaman asla boşa geçmiş zaman değildir.
Translation: Time spent among trees is never time wasted.
Hint: Spoken in a country that bridges Europe and Asia.
Regions: Middle East, Southeastern Europe, Eastern Mediterranean

Example Sentence: သင်သွားလေရာရာ၌ သင့်၏အစိတ်အပိုင်းတစ်ခုဖြစ်လာသည်။
Translation: Wherever you go becomes a part of you somehow.
Hint: This language echoes through centuries of empire—from the Pagan Kingdom to British Burma—carried by kings, monks, and revolutionaries alike.

Example Sentence: Гарне життя – це сукупність щасливих моментів.
Translation: A good life is a collection of happy moments.
Hint: Similar to Russian but uses a soft “i” more often—think “yi” or “i” instead of “e.”

Example Sentence: Ochi pentru ochi va orbi întreaga lume.
Translation: An eye for an eye will make the whole world blind.
Hint: This Romance language is spoken where vampires roam, castles rise, and Latin meets Slavic flair.

Example Sentence: Geluk is niet iets kant-en-klaars. Het komt voort uit je eigen daden.
Translation: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions
Hint: This language sails in on tall ships and bikes. spoken in the land of windmills, and waffles.

Example Sentence: Mõistus, mida on venitanud uus kogemus, ei saa kunagi naasta oma vanadesse mõõtmetesse.
Translation: A mind that is stretched by a new experience can never go back to its old dimensions.
Hint: It’s closely related to Finnish, and they can sometimes understand each other.

Example Sentence: ຈິດໃຈແມ່ນທຸກສິ່ງທຸກຢ່າງ. ສິ່ງທີ່ທ່ານຄິດວ່າທ່ານກາຍເປັນ.
Translation: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
Hint: Spoken in the land of waterfalls, sticky rice, and silent power—this language flows as gently as the Mekong River.

Example Sentence: ერთადერთი ჭეშმარიტი სიბრძნე იმაშია, რომ იცოდე, არაფერი იცი.
Translation: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
Hint: This language shares the same name as a famous southern state in the U.S.

Example Sentence: ነገ እንደምትሞት ኑር። ለዘላለም እንደምትኖር ተማር።
Translation: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
Hint: This ancient Semitic language is written with its own script and spoken in the highlands of East Africa—where coffee was born and kings once ruled from stone castles.

Example Sentence: Tipunin mo ang mga alaala, hindi mga bagay.
Translation: Collect moments, not things.
Hint: Spoken in the islands where volcanoes roar and karaoke never sleeps. This language dances through this island country with heart and humor.

Example Sentence: Őrizd és becsüld a halványkék pontot, az egyetlen otthont, amelyet valaha ismertünk.
Translation: Preserve and cherish the pale blue dot, the only home we've ever known.
Hint: It's famous for paprika, goulash, and thermal baths.

Example Sentence: Υποφέρουμε πιο συχνά στη φαντασία παρά στην πραγματικότητα.
Translation: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
Hint: Spoken in the land of philosophers, olives, and gods—this ancient language helped invent Western civilization and still slaps today.

Example Sentence: හොඳ සංචාරකයෙකුට ස්ථිර සැලසුම් නොමැති අතර, ළඟා වීමටත් ඔහු බලාපොරොත්තු වන්නේ නැත.
Translation: A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.
Hint: Spoken on the teardrop island below India, this curly-scripted language flows like a jungle river and sips tea like royalty.

Example Sentence: Ny miaina no zavatra tsy fahita indrindra eto an-tany. Ny ankamaroan'ny olona dia misy, izany ihany.
Translation: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
Hint: Spoken on the giant island off Africa’s east coast, this language is part African, part Southeast Asian, and 100% unexpected.

Example Sentence: Dünyada hər şey ol, amma heç vaxt vicdansız qalma.
Translation: Be anything in the world, but never be without a conscience.
Hint: Spoken between mountains and oil fields, this language blends Turkish vibes with Persian poetry and Soviet spice.

Example Sentence: វឌ្ឍនភាពកើតចេញពីការផ្លាស់ប្តូររបៀបដែលអ្នកមើលឃើញពិភពលោក។
Translation: Progress only comes from changing how you see the world.
Hint: Spoken in the land of ancient temples and street food dreams, this language has a script that looks like it belongs in a secret treasure map.

Example Sentence: הרגע המשמח ביותר בחיי האדם הוא היציאה לארצות לא נודעות.
Translation: The gladdest moment in human life is a departure into unknown lands.
Hint: This ancient language came back from the dead, and now it’s spoken from the synagogues to the startup scene.

Example Sentence: Livet er enten et dristig eventyr eller ingenting i det hele tatt.
Translation: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
Hint: This language loves waffles, fjords, and trolls in the forest. Spoken where the sun doesn't set in summer.

Example Sentence: Rejser er det eneste, du køber, som gør dig rigere.
Translation: Travel is the only thing you buy that makes you richer.
Hint: Known for its “soft” pronunciation that even confuses other Scandinavians.

Example Sentence: Ko te haere, ko te ora.
Translation: To travel is to live.
Hint: An indigenous language from the land of the long white cloud — where haka meets hobbits.

Example Sentence: همهٔ کسانی که سرگردانند، گم‌گشته نیستند.
Translation: Not all those who wander are lost.
Hint: This poetic language gave the world Rumi, saffron rice, and legendary carpets.
Regions: Middle East, South Asia, Central Asia

Example Sentence: Svijet je knjiga, a oni koji ne putuju čitaju samo jednu stranicu.
Translation: The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only one page.
Hint: Spoken across the Balkans — think rakija, Roman ruins, and dramatic coastline drama.

Example Sentence: Við ferðast á yfirborði kúlunnar. Ég veit að leiðir okkar hljóta að mætast.
Translation: We travel on the surface of a sphere. I know our paths must cross.
Hint: Vikings spoke it and is spoken on a land of fire and ice.

Example Sentence: Saya membaca untuk memahami makna kehidupan.
Translation: I read to make sense of life.
Hint: Used in a region where you’d eat satay, laksa, and nasi goreng.

Example Sentence: Ota mukaasi vain muistot, jätä jälkeesi vain jalanjäljet.
Translation: Take only memories, leave only footprints.
Hint: Has 15 grammatical cases and is used by sauna masters and heavy metal fans.

Example Sentence: Jobb fyller fickan, men äventyr fyller själen.
Translation: Jobs fill your pocket, but adventures fill your soul.
Hint: ABBA, IKEA, and meatballs. This melodic language comes from the land of minimalist vibes.

Example Sentence: Ať jdeš kamkoli, jdi tam celým svým srdcem.
Translation: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.
Hint: This language comes from a country that drinks more beer per person than any other. This Slavic language is full of consonants.

Example Sentence: Aan die einde betreur ons net die kanse wat ons nie geneem het nie.
Translation: In the end, we only regret the chances we didn’t take.
Hint: A cousin of Dutch, spoken in the land of safaris and braais.

Example Sentence: Çasti më i gëzueshëm në jetën njerëzore është një nisje drejt tokave të panjohura.
Translation: The gladdest moment in human life is a departure into unknown lands.
Hint: The only surviving member of its language family in Europe. The flag of it's country showcases double eagles

Example Sentence: Не отивай там, където пътят може да те отведе; отиди вместо това там, където няма път, и остави следа.
Translation: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
Hint: A Slavic tongue spoken by the Black Sea’s western shores.

Example Sentence: E sega ni rawa ni kunea na tamata na wasawasa vou kevaka e sega ni doudou me yali mai na baravi.
Translation: Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore.
Hint: An Oceanic language spoken on tropical islands famous for rugby and kava.

Example Sentence: Pa gen peyi etranje. Se sèlman vwayajè a ki etranje.
Translation: There are no foreign lands. It is the traveler only who is foreign.
Hint: A French-based Creole born from Africa and the Caribbean.

Example Sentence: Foghlaimíonn taistealaithe go mbaineann an eagla le daoine nach dtéann amach mórán.
Translation: Travelers learn that fear is for people who don't get out much.
Hint: A Celtic voice from a rainy island on Europe’s edge.

Example Sentence: Өмір қысқа, ал дүние кең.
Translation: Life is short and the world is wide.
Hint: A Turkic tongue from the land of wide grasslands, high mountains, and Borat

Example Sentence: تەشین، نەفەسین، فیرۆتین، لێکۆلین… گەشتکردن ژیانە.
Translation: To move, to breathe, to fly, to float… to travel is to live.
Hint: A language split by borders and mountains in across the middle east.

Example Sentence: Бактылуулук – бул жетчү станция эмес, ал эми жол жүрүүнүн ыкмасы.
Translation: Happiness is not a station you arrive at, but a manner of traveling.
Hint: Found in the heart of Central Asia’s mountains and lakes.

Example Sentence: Dari, ko vari, ar to, kas tev ir, tur, kur esi.
Translation: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
Hint: A Baltic tongue spoken where forests meet the sea.

Example Sentence: Visada atrodo neįmanoma, kol tai nepadaroma.
Translation: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
Hint: A Baltic tongue from the land of lakes and forests.

Example Sentence: D’Geschicht gëtt vun de Gewënner geschriwwen.
Translation: History is written by the victors.
Hint: A tiny country’s mix of Germanic and French influences.

Example Sentence: Бид түүхийг бүтээгчид биш. Бид түүхээр бүтээгдсэн.
Translation: We are not makers of history. We are made by history.
Hint: Spoken by descendants of horsemen who built the largest empire in history.

Example Sentence: अतीतबारे तपाईंलाई जति धेरै थाहा छ, भविष्यका लागि तपाईं त्यति नै राम्रोसँग तयार हुनुहुन्छ।
Translation: The more you know about the past, the better prepared you are for the future.
Hint: Spoken at the foot of the Himalayas.

Example Sentence: Агар хоҳӣ ояндаро муайян кунӣ, гузаштаро биомӯз.
Translation: Study the past if you would define the future.
Hint: A Persian cousin spoken high in the Pamir Mountains.

Example Sentence: Tarix hech qachon o‘zini takrorlamaydi, lekin u ko‘pincha qofiyadosh bo‘ladi.
Translation: History never repeats itself, but it does often rhyme.
Hint: Spoken where the Silk Road cities once thrived.

Example Sentence: Lowo ovula umnyango wesikole, uvala ijele.
Translation: He who opens a school door, closes a prison.
Hint: A Bantu language full of clicks, from southern Africa.

Example Sentence: ⴰⵎⴰⵥⴰⵢ ⴷ ⵜⵉⵎⵓⵔⵜ ⵉⵙⴳⴰ ⴰⴽⴽⴰ ⵜⴰⵎⵉⵔⵉⵙⵜ.
Translation: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.
Hint: North African mountain and desert tongue. Think camels and the color blue.

Example Sentence: Мудрасць пачынаецца з дзіва.
Translation: Wisdom begins in wonder.
Hint: A Slavic language squeezed between Russian and Polish.

Example Sentence: ཤེས་རིག་གིས་གསུངས་ཀྱི་ཡོད་ཀྱང་ ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱིས་ཉན་ནུས།
Translation: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
Hint: Spoken in a Himalayan kingdom of thunder dragons.

Example Sentence: Yachayniyuq runaqa yupaynanpaq sonqon nisqanta tikrayman, ama llullaqa manan chayta ruwanchu.
Translation: A wise man changes his mind, a fool never will.
Hint: The language of the Incas, still alive in the Andes.

Example Sentence: 我哋喺想像中受苦嘅次數，多過喺現實中。
Translation: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
Hint: Spoken in the southern reaches of China, by the Pearl River.

Example Sentence: Ebda raġel mhu liberu jekk mhux sidu nnifsu.
Translation: No man is free who is not master of himself.
Hint: Only Semitic language written in latin script. Also the name of a tiny white dog.

Example Sentence: Klou er a chais el me a ngar er telkib, a ngar el dengerasek el diak.
Translation: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
Hint: A Micronesian language spoken on beautiful Pacific islands.

Example Sentence: மனிதன் தன்னை வென்றால் உலகத்தையும் வெல்வான்.
Translation: Man conquers the world by conquering himself.
Hint: One of the oldest classical langauges, spoken across Southeast Asia.

Example Sentence: Akukho nto inkulu eyenziwayo ngoko nangoko.
Translation: No great thing is created suddenly.
Hint: A South African Bantu language famous for its clicks.
